title: Belfast Poetry Festival 2015
text:
Belfast Poetry Festival 2015 By Staff | Oct 20, 2015 Photo by: Ethan Andrews Portland jazz fusion poet and singer Lady Zen closes the Belfast Poetry Festival's Saturday night multimedia show at the Colonial Theatre. 
Belfast — The 11th annual Belfast Poetry Festival took place Friday and Saturday, Oct. 16 and 17, at two city venues. 
Friday night, Belfast Free Library’s Abbott Room saw a standing-room-only crowd in place for reading by invited guest poet Elizabeth Gordon McKim; the 10 finalists of this year’s Maine Postmark Poetry Contest, almost all of who were on hand to read their poems; and a fast-moving open mic session. 
Just-previous Belfast Poet Laureate Ellen Sander announced the contest winners, as judged by Baron Wormser: Laurence Coe of Rockland, first place; Richard Foerster of Cape Neddick, second; Jackie Ascrizzi of Montville, third; and Jay Franzel of Wayne, honorable mention. 
After Saturday morning workshops and a lively afternoon panel addressing poetry as a provoker of social dialogue at the library, the festival moved to the Colonial Theatre for a reception and a night of collaborations between poets and visual artists, musicians and artists of other disciplines. The multimedia extravaganza was held in the Colonial's Dreamland for the first time and featured 14 poets, seven visual artists and 14 performing artists from around Maine and beyond.
